intro: Languas brachyantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant features slender, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in a daisy-like pattern. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Languas brachyantha is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in drought conditions.
